page.title: 15EDUCATION.McMillan Centre.
page.content: The Margaret McMillan Field Study Centre is situated in seventeen acres of land just above Wrotham Hill.The founder, Margaret McMillan originally set up the centre for nursery children from the deprived areas of London.It was first opened by the Duchess of York in 1936.It now belongs to Goldsmith's Collage in London.The centre offers both residential and day field study corses for primary children in the London 'ILEA' area.It is also used by students from Goldsmith's collage. The centre has labortories, dormitories, classrooms, dining rooms, tennis courts and naturally lots of open space.A seventeenth century barn lies at the back of the building.A preservation order has been placed upon it.
